This is a fantastic opportunity to work for my client at a leading Hospice which aspires to a world in which all dying people and those close to them have access to care and support, whenever and wherever they need it. Proudly celebrating over 50 years and with a turnover of over £20 million, they provide invaluable care and support to over 7,500 people across the five London Boroughs of Bromley, Croydon, Lambeth, Lewisham and Southwark.
Your new role
As the Oral History Project Administrator, you will provide administrative support to the Project Lead and, when required, the volunteers in the development of the oral history project, from inception to the opening of an exhibition within a brand-new state of the art Centre for Awareness and Response to End of Life Care (CARE). You will provide day to day administrative support towards the project, such as ensuring all correspondence, both postal and electronic are answered in a timely fashion, maintaining any databases of volunteers and activities and maintaining all the electronic equipment required for the project, ensuring it is in working order at all times and creating an electronic system for volunteers to book in and return all equipment. You will also be involved in supporting the Project Lead throughout the process of recruiting and training volunteers.
This role is being offered on a 12 to 18 months Fixed Term Contract.
To succeed in this role
You will have a significant amount of administration experience and be proficient in the use of Microsoft Office and Outlook. Possessing a sound working knowledge of event organisation and social media is essential to this role. You will adopt a flexible approach and willingness to work either on site, or other community locations as agreed with the Project Leads. It is equally important to us that you are professional, easily approachable and work well on your own initiative and as part of a team, and can deal with pressure.
If this sounds like you, we will be excited to hear from you!
You will gain a stimulating and rewarding role with an opportunity to influence and make a real difference in the community
Access to excellent training and development opportunities
A number of health and wellbeing schemes
A competitive contributory pension scheme and life assurance scheme with generous beneficiary plan
Access to plenty of free local street parking.
Closing Date: 29th November 2020 at Midnight
Interview Date: TBC
In the event we receive a high amount of applications, we reserve the right to close the job earlier than the initial closing date.

Wellness programmes

Monday to Friday

Enterprise Data Achitect
Location
Any UK Capgemini base Location and client sites nationwide
An overview of the role
The Enterprise Data Management practice within the Insights and Data business unit of Capgemini is a global practice covering a broad range of business and IT focused topics from Information Strategy, Governance, Master Data Management, Data Architecture, Migration and Lifecycle Management. We help our clients build an enterprise class data platform that allows them to develop business capability by exploiting data to gain insight. The team are first and foremost Consultants, putting client requirements and industry best practice at the heart of delivery.
The role
As a Data Architect/Information Strategy Consultant within Capgemini, you will be working within the Enterprise Data Management practice alongside some of the top experts in the country, on large and complex client engagements across a variety of industry sectors. You will be given the opportunity to grow and take on responsibility from day one in a challenging but rewarding and meritocratic environment. The right candidate will quickly rise to senior positions on projects and within the practice.
The work
Consulting, leading, and performance of analysis and design of large, complex applications, and business process re-engineering required to support Data programmes
Contributing to the analysis of business data requirements, developing Information Strategies, Conceptual and Corporate data models, and working to develop and extend the client's Data Architecture
Partnering with clients to gather necessary understanding of business objectives and processes
Focussing on identifying the underlying data issues using interviews, tools, templates, and diagnostics
Providing information, feedback and guidance to clients to support technology-related decision making
Consulting and working with development teams to determine, execute and deliver relevant solutions
Working with colleagues to develop new offerings in the areas of Information Strategy and Data Architecture development
Managing the development of reviewees
Why you?
Hands-on experience with at least 3 of the following: Data Management, Data Architecture, Data Migration, Data Modelling, Data/Information Strategy, Information Governance
Experience with leading data applications for Tier 1 vendors such as IBM, SAP, Oracle and others or development of corporate strategies and data models
Demonstrable experience on several data related projects. This needs to include significant experience of at least two of: data architecture design, information strategy, development of a corporate data model, ETL design, data mapping, data quality assessment, data/information governance
Demonstrable experience of at least 2 data architecture or strategy programmes
Why us?
Professional development. Accelerated career progression. An environment that encourages entrepreneurial spirit. It's all on offer at Capgemini. And although collaboration is at the core of the way we work, we also recognise individual needs with a flexible benefits package you can tailor to suit you.
Why we're different
At Capgemini, we help organisations across the world become more agile, more competitive and more successful. Smart, tailored, often ground-breaking technical solutions to complex problems are the norm. But so, too, is a culture that's as collaborative as it is forward thinking. Working closely with each other, and with our clients, we get under the skin of businesses and to the heart of their goals. You will too.
Diversity
Capgemini positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates
regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion or belief, marital
status, or pregnancy and maternity. We are committed to hiring, developing and retaining the best
people to deliver innovative, world-class solutions for our clients. We foster an inclusive culture
that enables everyone to achieve their full potential and enjoy a fulfilling career with us. Our
comprehensive flexible benefits package and lifestyle policies enable our employees to balance
their individual, family and work-life needs.
About Capgemini
Capgemini is a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services. The Group is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients' opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year+ heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company of 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of €17billion.

Our client operates a warehouse cross dock facility in Dartford and they require a warehouse administrator to join their team at their customers site in South East London.
The ideal candidate should have excellent administration and organisational skills, along with an eye for detail. The job will include checking and validating of orders on the in house system, production of in house documentation, maintenance of the database, filing, scanning, emailing and other tasks as required by site management.

Advertising job title
Procurement Services Apprenticeship (Business Administration)

11-Nov-2020

Job Description
Procurement Services Apprenticeship (Business Administration)
Starting salary: £18,000 p/a moving to £22,000 p/a through the successful completion of course modules & personal development milestones.

Southern Water are currently recruiting an Apprentice Procurement Services Assistant to join our busy Procurement team in Worthing, West Sussex. Remote working is currently supported within this role due to Covid-19.

We are looking for candidates who are passionate about developing their careers within the world of procurement and supply chain management, and this is an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic and progressive team with real scope for growth and development. This apprenticeship programme will develop your skills, professional qualifications, and experience to equip you for a role within Procurement at Southern Water.

The Procurement Services Assistant role is critical to ensure Operational continuity and the timely processing of Purchase Orders across our business. This will involve liaising with suppliers and internal stakeholders to resolve Purchase Order exceptions and issues.

The Procurement Services Assistant will provide support to the Procurement Services Manager in the contract management and service improvement of outsourced Procurement services and systems, and undertake administrative support for transactional (non-strategic), tactical and P2P Procurement activity to support the business, Category, Sourcing and Supplier & Contract Management Teams.

Key activities will include:
•Creating and updating purchase orders across all categories and sub categories of spend
•Providing first line support to outsourced Procurement Services team members
•Maintaining the procurement contract database
•Supporting stakeholders with requests of goods/services not within our catalogue and constructively challenging where appropriate/necessary
•Liaising with suppliers to resolve queries and exceptions

A Procurement Services Assistant therefore needs excellent interpersonal and organisational skills, a passion for service, and a commercial mind-set. Self-motivation, adaptability and resilience are also important qualities for this role, as well as being a team player. Advanced Microsoft Office skills and strong numerical and data analysis skills. Maths & English at GCSE A-C/4+ is essential for this role.

This role is the first step towards a career in Procurement; enabling exposure to Procurement operations. As part of our Apprenticeship Programme, this could progress on to a Category Specialist Apprenticeship; which would provide industry specific training & accreditation.

Southern Water has one of the largest Procurement departments within the South East. If you are interested in a diverse career within Procurement and Supply Chain Management, this scheme provides an excellent opportunity for you!

Why join Southern Water?

This is an exciting time to be a Southern Water employee. To tackle the challenges we face, we’re changing, at pace, to become brilliant at the basics and to manage the environment, through a reliable, future-proof network, at a price everyone can afford, and with great customer service at every step.
At the same time, we’re innovating across all areas of our business, from improving how we deliver services, to leading the way on issues such as single-use plastics.

We’re building an inclusive culture. Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We are creating a workplace where all people feel welcomed, respected, supported and appreciated, no matter who they are or where they come from.

We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds and do not discriminate on the grounds of age, cultural background, disability, gender, marital status, nationality, political belief, race, religion or sexual orientation.

Job Title: Oracle System Administrator - Payroll - Fusion HCM (Cloud)
Job Description:
This role will be responsible for providing support and maintenance of organisation wide Oracle Cloud system, as part of the Shared Service Centre team. The remit will include the provision of administration, configuration and application support for the organisation's key business applications as well as being responsible for user administration, issue and defect resolution, release management, and enhancements.

As an Oracle System Administrator - Technical Payroll your duties and responsibilities will be:
30% Technical & 70% functional.
Working within Oracle Cloud HCM
Perform analysis, troubleshooting and deliver solutions on assigned work via service desk requests
Work with customers and/or consultants to facilitate business requirements engineering, documenting current and future state scenarios, design and configurations, and update documents as changes occur
Perform system-wide setups and configurations to meet human resources, payroll and benefits requirements, including yet not limited to value sets, elements, payroll flows, benefit plans, eligibility rules and life events, etc.
Develop new and/or maintain existing fast formulas in accordance with payroll and benefits compensation and legislative requirements.
Develop medium to complex OBIEE BI Publisher reports, together with XML templates
Coordinate with HR resources and partake in testing activities for system-wide updates, upgrades, quarterly releases and patches, and document test results Recommend changes and/or update testing scripts as necessary
Perform user profile management tasks, either manually through Security Console or with the use of Rest APIs and Postman UI
Perform HCM Data Loader, HDL Extracts and HCM Spreadsheet Data Loader tasks for various business objects.

Skills & Knowledge Requirements

Must have worked in at least two Oracle Fusion HCM data conversions (to and from, preferred)
Experience working OBIEE BI Publisher and Fast Formulas, a must have
Excellent knowledge of MS Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, and Visio
Applied knowledge with the Oracle Fusion HCM data model (HR, Payroll, Benefits)
Applied knowledge with OBIEE BI Publisher reports
Applied knowledge with HDL and HSDL business objects for HR, Payroll and Benefits
Applied knowledge with integration between Oracle Fusion HCM, Taleo, time collection systems and other external cloud-bases systems
Applied knowledge with Fast Formulas for Payroll and Benefits
Technical writing (requirements, design and configuration documents, test plans)
In-depth or applied knowledge of or skills in installing, configuring, and implementing applications, databases, and web technologies
In-depth or applied knowledge of or skills in diagnosing, repairing and communicating the status of applications, systems, and web technology implementations supported as a level three resource

Addition Information

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field and relevant Agile work experience, including functional and technical experience with Oracle Fusion HCM.

Why
Data is the core of the investment process and our quantitative driven strategies team. Data Engineers design and build our data platforms, and source, enrich, and store data that integrates into the investment process. Our Data Engineers own the entire data pipeline starting with how the firm ingests data from the outside world, transforming that information into actionable insights and signals, and ultimately designing the interfaces and APIs that our quantitative researchers use to productionise ideas. Data Engineers partner with some of the World’s leading investment and quantitative professionals to design systems that solve our most critical problems and answer the most challenging questions in finance.

Position
Develop solutions that enable investment professionals and alpha researchers to efficiently extract insights from data. Owning the ingestion (web scrapes, S3/FTP sync, sensor collection), transformations (SQL, Kafka, Python/C#/Java/Python), and interface (API, schema design, events)
Partner with the industry’s top investment professionals, quantitative researchers to design, develop, and deploy solutions that answer fundamental questions about financial markets.
Design and develop large scale and complex solutions for security master and portfolio management
Build tools and automation capabilities for data pipelines that improve the efficiency, quality and resiliency of our data platform
Driving the key data agenda working directly with portfolio managers, research, trading, operations and other technology teams
Drive the evolution of our data strategy by challenging the status quo and identifying opportunities to enhance our platform

Firm
This position is with one of the World’s leading and most successful Hedge Funds and headquartered in London (Knightsbridge). They run several billion dollars in asset under management and have approximately 300 staff members worldwide, 60+ person Technology group that has won several awards for technological innovations. You would be joining an award-winning group who have delivered solutions to highly complex problems, and the team contains several MVP´s, MCM´s, Authors, Speakers, and recognised technical specialists. We look for, hire and compensate for the very best engineers in the World who proactively push boundaries of what is possible and has a burning desire to deliver products.

The working environment is best described as extremely fast-paced, flat, meritocratic, collaborative and open. It is an environment that is suitable for experienced engineers that have genuine expertise in their specialist subjects, engineers with a “get stuff done” mentality and do not require managing, hand-holding, strong direction, or Business Analysts, Project Managers or Architects owning products and/or projects on their behalf. We are hiring for the expertise and the value that this expertise brings to the firm, including the existing team being able to learn for you, as well as the character needed to deliver end to end solutions, and sometimes under pressure.

Free daily cooked breakfast and lunch

Passion for working with data in order to accurately model and analyze complex systems such as a publicly-traded company, commodity market, economy, or financial instruments
